Dear Ms. Thomas:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
June 12, 2018. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4152 Initial documentation.
At the time of admission, all of the following shall be in the
resident's case record:
(a) Name, address, birth date, sex, gender, race, height,
weight, hair color, eye color, identifying marks,
religious preference, and school status.
(b) A photograph taken within the previous 12 months.
(c) A brief description of the resident's preparation for
placement and general physical and emotional state
at the time of admission.
(d) Name, address, and marital status of parents and
name and address of legal guardian, if known.
(h) A brief description of the circumstances leading
to the need for care.
REPEAT VIOLATION
Initial documentation information was not completed at the time
of admission for two of three residents. The last CAP indicated
the case planner would ensure this information was completed
timely and placed in the resident’s file.
4

2.) ISEP requirements do not apply to this agency as they do not accept minors from the
foster care or juvenile justice system.
3.) This facility contracts with the Children’s Services Agency. This report will be
forwarded to Housing Specialist Manager, Janet Kaley.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
If the agency wishes to transfer a resident who has turned 18 in their CCI program to
their adult program, the resident must be formally discharged from the CCI program
and a discharge summary must be completed.
Performance evaluations should be signed and dated by the employee and their
supervisor.
V. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility submitted one corrective action plan addressing employee records,
initial documentation and discharge plans during this licensing period.
5

VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
